para: This command creates a second µ based on an ℑ already loaded in another µ.
The name parameter is the name of the new µ. If set to automatic the µ name will be taken from the ℑ name.
The image parameter must be a path to an existing ℑ object.

The new µ will have the same pixel size as the given image. Its physical size will be the same as the size of the µ containing image old µ if both width and height are automatic. If one dimension is numeric and the other is automatic, the µ will be scaled to that new size while preserving the aspect ratio of the original µ. If both dimensions are numeric, the new µ might have a different aspect ratio from the original.
Other than the ℑ and size, the new µ will not inherit any other data from the original. It will have no &materials;, pixel groups, or &skels;.
